text:
riers to self-management, do not blame, rather affirm
• Call the woman back to the high-risk clinic two weeks later; advise her to come “fasted” in the morning, carrying
her breakfast with her.
• Check fasting blood glucose level (glucometer) on arrival and then two hours after breakfast (post-prandial).
o If fasting blood sugar <5.3 mmol/L, post-prandial <7 mmol/L, it is appropriate to continue with dietary
management.
o R echeck  fasting and post-prandial blood glucose every two weeks.
